Japanese: さて、次はどの部屋を調べようか‥‥‥。
English: Okay, so which room should I investigate next...?

Japanese: ２階の廊下だ‥‥‥。ここは照明がついていて結構明るいな。まだ生存者が残っていればいいんだが‥‥‥。
English: The second floor corridor... The light's on, so it's not as dark here. I hope there are still some survivors here...

Japanese: 床には血痕が残っている。かなり時間が経つのか血が固まっている。
English: There are blood stains on the floor. The blood's gotten dry, so I think some time have passed.

Japanese: この血痕を見ると２階でもかなり殺られているようだな。
English: Judging by all the blood, I guess a lot of people were killed here too.

Japanese: 警察の廊下が一瞬で血の海になるなんて、誰も予測してなかった事だろうな。
English: No one probably ever imagined a police station's floor would turn into a sea of blood in a matter of moments.

Japanese: この部屋は会議室だったな。薄暗くて気味の悪い部屋だ‥‥‥。
English: That was the meeting room. There's not much light there and it's creepy.

Japanese: ２階の扉は全部で５つか‥‥‥どこが何の部屋かは判らないな。こりゃ、片っ端から調べてみるほうがよさそうだな。
English: There are five doors in total here... I have no idea where they lead. I'd better start investigating.

Japanese: とにかく入ってみない事には何も判らないな。
English: I won't know what's inside until I go in.

Japanese: ここは署長室だったな。今となっては、ここの署長も殺られている可能性はでかいぞ。
English: That was the station chief's office. It's possible he was killed too.

Japanese: ２階の扉は全部で５つか‥‥‥どこが何の部屋かは判らないな。こりゃ、片っ端から調べてみるほうがよさそうだな。
English: There are five doors in total here... I have no idea where they lead. I'd better start investigating.

Japanese: とにかく入ってみない事には何も判らないな。
English: I won't know what's inside until I go in.

Japanese: この電算室では、かなり殺られていたようだな‥‥‥。
English: More people dead in this computer room...

Japanese: ２階の扉は全部で５つか‥‥‥どこが何の部屋かは判らないな。こりゃ、片っ端から調べてみるほうがよさそうだな。
English: There are five doors in total here... I have no idea where they lead. I'd better start investigating.

Japanese: とにかく入ってみない事には何も判らないな。
English: I won't know what's inside until I go in.

Japanese: ここは取調べ室だったな‥‥‥。ここで書類整理をしていた刑事も殺られてしまったんだ‥‥‥。
English: This is the interrogation room. The person who was organizing documents was also killed.

Japanese: ２階の扉は全部で５つか‥‥‥どこが何の部屋かは判らないな。こりゃ、片っ端から調べてみるほうがよさそうだな。
English: There are five doors in total here... I have no idea where they lead. I'd better start investigating.

Japanese: とにかく入ってみない事には何も判らないな。
English: I won't know what's inside until I go in.

Japanese: この扉だけ他のものとは違った造りになっているみたいだな。とても頑丈そうな扉だが、一体何の部屋だろう‥‥‥。
English: This door is built different than everything else here. It's way more sturdy -- I wonder what's in there...

Japanese: この警察署には留置所がない筈だし‥‥‥ま、考えるより入ってみるのが一番手っ取り早いな。
English: There is probably no detention facility in this police station... Well, instead of thinking about it too much I should just go in and see.

Japanese: こんな所に消火器が置いてある。警察も火事には弱いか‥‥‥。
English: Huh, there's a fire hydrant here. I guess the police aren't very good with fires.

Japanese: かなり古い消火器だな‥‥‥取っ手が錆付いているぞ。これじゃ火事になっても使用できなさそうだ。
English: This is a pretty old fire extinguisher, the handle is all rusty. I don't think it could even put out a fire!

Japanese: この消火器を武器にしようと思ったけど、使えないんじゃ仕方ないな。
English: I thought about using the fire extinguisher as a weapon, but I don't think it'd be very good.

Japanese: <IF>使い物にならないものを持って歩く訳にはいかないな。邪魔になるだけだ<ELSE>使用できない消火器なんてただ重いだけで何の役にも立たないな<ENDIF>。
English: <IF>I don't want to lug useless stuff around. It'll just get in the way.<ELSE>Carrying a heavy, broken fire extinguishers is more trouble than it's worth.<ENDIF>

Japanese: <IF >もう１度<ENDIF>このドアの開いている部屋を調べてみるか‥‥‥。
English: <IF >I should investigate the room behind this door one more time.<ELSE>I should investigate the room behind this door.<ENDIF>

Japanese: この部屋は扉が閉まっているな‥‥‥。<IF >もう１度調べてみようか。<ENDIF>
English: <IF >The door to this room is closed... Let's investigate it again.<ELSE>The door to this room is closed... <ENDIF>

Japanese: <IF >この部屋は死体が多いせいか、何か匂うな。<ELSE>扉が閉まっているとなんだか無気味だな‥‥‥。<ENDIF>
English: <IF >There are a lot of corpses inside, and I can smell them out here.<ELSE>The door is closed, which is a little creepy...<ENDIF>

Japanese: <IF >たしかこの部屋は警官が死んでいたな。<ELSE>この部屋はドアが開いているぞ。<ENDIF>
English: <IF >That room's door is open.<ELSE>The officer in there is definitely dead.<ENDIF>

Japanese: <IF >もう１度<ENDIF>この部屋を調べてみるか‥‥‥。
English: <IF >Once more... Let's investigate that room.<ELSE>Let's investigate that room.<ENDIF>
